results.title: Not for publication
results.creator_credit: Juli Stopp, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Juli Stopp tells the story that she has waited her whole life to tell, of the time she nearly died and the tools that she arms herself with to not only survive but be happy.

results.title: [The Working women's centre]
results.creator_credit: Laura Butterworth, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: As the Working Women’s Centre in South Australia faces budget cuts, Laura Butterworth reflects on the history of the centre, the stories of the women workers and the battles fought and won.

results.title: The Keeper of the rings
results.creator_credit: Kathleen Comber, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: For her pa, her dad and, most importantly, her mum, Kathleen Comber is the keeper of the rings. They encapsulate the pain and joys of her family thorughout the generations.

results.title: Learning Lucie style
results.creator_credit: Elizabeth Creese, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Being born with cerebral palsy has forced Lucie to learn things in different ways to other children. In turn, she has proven to be a great teacher to Elizabeth Creese and her family.

results.title: Exploring...immersive art pedagogy
results.creator_credit: Geraldine Burke, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Geraldine Burke’s addiction to daydreaming sometimes got her into trouble but also took her to many wonderful places. Eventually she found the thing that could bring her daydreams to life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geraldine Burke, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Sunday drives
results.creator_credit: Fiona Tinney, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Fiona Tinney delves into the jigsaw of the past, the stories she heard while going on Sunday drives with the family. Even though she was not very interested at the time, these stories, melded with the towns they drove through have imprinted on her memory as Tinney tries to hold on to them.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fiona Tinney, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Fiona Tinney delves into the jigsaw of the past, the stories she heard while going on Sunday drives with the family. Even though she was not very interested at the time, these stories, melded with the towns they drove through have imprinted on her memory as Tinney tries to hold on to them.

results.title: The Varnished truth
results.creator_credit: Elly Temelcos, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Elly Temelcos and her two sisters spent hours over the years listening to her father’s stories, about life in the village, the war that tore his country apart and the sorrow of separation.

results.title: Here, there & back again
results.creator_credit: Wayne Hornsby, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Wayne Hornsby was in Thailand when he was diagnosed with HIV. He reflects on his journey, nearly dying and his return to Australia, where his work in helping HIV positive people eventually leads him back to Thailand.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wayne Hornsby, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Wayne Hornsby was in Thailand when he was diagnosed with HIV. He reflects on his journey, nearly dying and his return to Australia, where his work in helping HIV positive people eventually leads him back to Thailand.
